results.title: Cycle of progress
results.brief_description: Operations of the Alcoa Aluminium Company in Western Australia. The first bauxite mining operations commenced in 1963 at Jarrahdale, Western Australia. The bauxite is taken by rail to the refinery at Kwinana from where the alumina is shipped to the smelters at Point Henry, Victoria and to industry all over the world. The benefits to Australia as a whole from the establishment of one of the largest aluminium industries in the world are stated.

results.title: Cycle of life
results.creator_credit: Peter Mills, Random Films and Soil Association
results.brief_description: An analysis of past and present human folly in exploiting and destroying the vitality of the soil. The film commences with the story of the fall of ancient civilizations. To avoid the disasters of the past, humans, as an integral part of nature, must obey the laws of life. The film claims that husbandry, based on an awareness of our inseparable partnership with nature, leads to the promotion of health and vitality in soil, and so in plant, in animal and in humans thereby completing the “cycle of life”.

results.title: Cycle logic - cycle safety
results.creator_credit: Aerospace Audio-Visual Services and F M Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates safe operation and handling of motor-cycles. Shows how to start, clutch, brake and accelerate. Explains anticipation riding in entering intersections, taking curves, changing lanes, keeping safe distances and avoiding road hazards. Covers city, country road and freeway conditions. Also stresses the importance of protective clothing and good posture.

results.title: Cutting oils and fluids
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Crabb, Michael Barden and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: The composition and qualities of the various types of water-based fluids and neat cutting oils; their function, the importance of selecting the right one for the job, and the benefits derived from good housekeeping and hygiene.

results.title: Cummington story
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of War Information. Overseas Operations Branch
results.brief_description: The story of the arrival in Cummington, USA, of a group of refugees from Europe and the manner in which they were accepted by the community. They are greeted by the minister of the local church, who has assumed the responsibility for their adjustment to a strange country, and has found a place for them to live. Then began the process of gradually breaking down the barriers between the new arrivals and the townspeople. Strangeness falls away, the minister implies, when people live and work and meet together. The story of this exercise in human relations is told with sympathy, understanding, and humour.

results.title: Cultured pearls
results.brief_description: The complete process of pearl culture. Women divers take oysters from the seabed, which are injected with tissue and kernels, and placed in wire baskets to mature in warm sea water in bays and inlets. A careful watch is kept on the temperature and conditions of the sea, and the oysters are moved in the water as necessary. The shells are cleaned once a year, until harvesting, when the pearls are removed, graded, inspected and made up for dealers.

results.title: Cultural stories
results.brief_description: There are 140 cultural groups living in Greater Dandenong, Victoria. To celebrate this cultural diversity this short documentary film presents Maria (Hungarian), Andreas (Greek Cypriot) and Rosanna (Chilean) as they each tell their personal story of their own background, family, culture and migrant experience to the sounds of traditional music and images of family photographs.

results.title: Cry of the marsh
results.creator_credit: Bill Snyder and Bill Snyder Films
results.brief_description: Marshes are the breeding grounds of millions of water-birds and untold numbers of interrelated wildlife. These precious wetlands are being drained, victims of man’s relentless search for more farmland and urban space. The film captures the poetic beauty of marsh life, then the terror and awesome finality which results when man reclaims a marsh for his purposes.
